page.title: 14Leisure in Woodhalls
page.content: The small farms which occupy this area offer their occupants very little spare time,and it is significant that many so-called 'leisure'activities are an integral part of rural life.These include the making of jams and chutneys,the preserving of meat and vegetables,and the brewing of wine and beer.Needlework and flower arranging are also popular, as are reading and television.Evenings spent wining and dining are also occasionally enjoyed, both at home hosting friends and at local hotels and pubs. There is considerable support for community affairs encompassing church and chapel, political organizations, local council committees,farming associations etc.Outdoor activities strongly associated with rural life cover:-riding club events,hunting, shooting,fishing and wildlife studies.
